-- | Records a <a>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</a> event in the
--   currently running workflow execution identified by the given domain,
--   workflowId, and runId. This logically requests the cancellation of the
--   workflow execution as a whole. It is up to the decider to take
--   appropriate actions when it receives an execution history with this
--   event.
--   
--   If the runId is not specified, the
--   <a>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</a> event is recorded in the
--   history of the current open workflow execution with the specified
--   workflowId in the domain. Because this action allows the workflow to
--   properly clean up and gracefully close, it should be used instead of
--   <tt>TerminateWorkflowExecution</tt> when possible. Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to
--   allow or deny permission to call this action. You cannot use an IAM
--   policy to constrain this action's parameters. If the caller does not
--   have sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter
--   values fall outside the specified constraints, the action fails. The
--   associated event attribute's cause parameter will be set to
--   OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and example IAM policies, see
--   <a>Using IAMto Manage Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/apireference/API_RequestCancelWorkflowExecution.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SWF.RequestCancelWorkflowExecution
data RequestCancelWorkflowExecution

-- | <a>RequestCancelWorkflowExecution</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rcweDomain</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcweRunId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcweWorkflowId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
requestCancelWorkflowExecution :: Text -> Text -> RequestCancelWorkflowExecution

-- | The name of the domain containing the workflow execution to cancel.
rcweDomain :: Lens' RequestCancelWorkflowExecution Text

-- | The runId of the workflow execution to cancel.
rcweRunId :: Lens' RequestCancelWorkflowExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The workflowId of the workflow execution to cancel.
rcweWorkflowId :: Lens' RequestCancelWorkflowExecution Text
data RequestCancelWorkflowExecutionResponse

-- | <a>RequestCancelWorkflowExecutionResponse</a> constructor.
requestCancelWorkflowExecutionResponse :: RequestCancelWorkflowExecutionResponse
instance Eq RequestCancelWorkflowExecution
instance Ord RequestCancelWorkflowExecution
instance Read RequestCancelWorkflowExecution
instance Show RequestCancelWorkflowExecution
instance Eq RequestCancelWorkflowExecutionResponse
instance Ord RequestCancelWorkflowExecutionResponse
instance Read RequestCancelWorkflowExecutionResponse
instance Show RequestCancelWorkflowExecutionResponse
instance Generic RequestCancelWorkflowExecutionResponse
instance Datatype D1RequestCancelWorkflowExecutionResponse
instance Constructor C1_0RequestCancelWorkflowExecutionResponse
instance AWSRequest RequestCancelWorkflowExecution
instance ToJSON RequestCancelWorkflowExecution
instance ToHeaders RequestCancelWorkflowExecution
instance ToQuery RequestCancelWorkflowExecution
instance ToPath RequestCancelWorkflowExecution


-- | Registers a new <i>workflow type</i> and its configuration settings in
--   the specified domain.
--   
--   The retention period for the workflow history is set by the
--   <tt>RegisterDomain</tt> action.
--   
--   If the type already exists, then a <tt>TypeAlreadyExists</tt> fault is
--   returned. You cannot change the configuration settings of a workflow
--   type once it is registered and it must be registered as a new version.
--   Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to
--   allow or deny permission to call this action. Constrain the following
--   parameters by using a <tt>Condition</tt> element with the appropriate
--   keys. 'defaultTaskList.name': String constraint. The key is
--   'swf:defaultTaskList.name'. <tt>name</tt>: String constraint. The key
--   is 'swf:name'. <tt>version</tt>: String constraint. The key is
--   'swf:version'. If the caller does not have sufficient permissions to
--   invoke the action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified
--   constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's cause
--   parameter will be set to OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and
--   example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to AmazonSWF
--   Workflows</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/apireference/API_RegisterWorkflowType.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SWF.RegisterWorkflowType
data RegisterWorkflowType

-- | <a>RegisterWorkflowType</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rwtDefaultChildPolicy</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>ChildPolicy</a></li>
--   <li><a>rwtDefaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rwtDefaultTaskList</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>TaskList</a></li>
--   <li><a>rwtDefaultTaskPriority</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rwtDefaultTaskStartToCloseTimeout</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rwtDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rwtDomain</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rwtName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rwtVersion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
registerWorkflowType :: Text -> Text -> Text -> RegisterWorkflowType

-- | If set, specifies the default policy to use for the child workflow
--   executions when a workflow execution of this type is terminated, by
--   calling the <tt>TerminateWorkflowExecution</tt> action explicitly or
--   due to an expired timeout. This default can be overridden when
--   starting a workflow execution using the
--   <tt>StartWorkflowExecution</tt> action or the
--   <a>StartChildWorkflowExecution</a> <a>Decision</a>.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   TERMINATE: the child executions will be terminated. REQUEST_CANCEL: a
--   request to cancel will be attempted for each child execution by
--   recording a <a>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</a> event in its
--   history. It is up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it
--   receives an execution history with this event. ABANDON: no action will
--   be taken. The child executions will continue to run.
rwtDefaultChildPolicy :: Lens' RegisterWorkflowType (Maybe ChildPolicy)

-- | If set, specifies the default maximum duration for executions of this
--   workflow type. You can override this default when starting an
--   execution through the <tt>StartWorkflowExecution</tt> Action or
--   <a>StartChildWorkflowExecution</a> <a>Decision</a>.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds; an integer greater than or equal
--   to 0. Unlike some of the other timeout parameters in Amazon SWF, you
--   cannot specify a value of <a>NONE</a> for
--   <tt>defaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout</tt>; there is a one-year max
--   limit on the time that a workflow execution can run. Exceeding this
--   limit will always cause the workflow execution to time out.
rwtDefaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' RegisterWorkflowType (Maybe Text)

-- | If set, specifies the default task list to use for scheduling decision
--   tasks for executions of this workflow type. This default is used only
--   if a task list is not provided when starting the execution through the
--   <tt>StartWorkflowExecution</tt> Action or
--   <a>StartChildWorkflowExecution</a> <a>Decision</a>.
rwtDefaultTaskList :: Lens' RegisterWorkflowType (Maybe TaskList)

-- | The default task priority to assign to the workflow type. If not
--   assigned, then "0" will be used. Valid values are integers that range
--   from Java's <a>MIN_VALUE</a> (-2147483648) to <a>MAX_VALUE</a>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon Simple Workflow Developer Guide</i>.
rwtDefaultTaskPriority :: Lens' RegisterWorkflowType (Maybe Text)

-- | If set, specifies the default maximum duration of decision tasks for
--   this workflow type. This default can be overridden when starting a
--   workflow execution using the <tt>StartWorkflowExecution</tt> action or
--   the <a>StartChildWorkflowExecution</a> <a>Decision</a>.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds; an integer greater than or equal
--   to 0. The value <a>NONE</a> can be used to specify unlimited duration.
rwtDefaultTaskStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' RegisterWorkflowType (Maybe Text)

-- | Textual description of the workflow type.
rwtDescription :: Lens' RegisterWorkflowType (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the domain in which to register the workflow type.
rwtDomain :: Lens' RegisterWorkflowType Text

-- | The name of the workflow type.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <a>/</a> (slash), '|' (vertical
--   bar), or any control characters (u0000-u001f | u007f - u009f). Also,
--   it must not contain the literal string quotarnquot.
rwtName :: Lens' RegisterWorkflowType Text

-- | The version of the workflow type.
--   
--   The workflow type consists of the name and version, the combination of
--   which must be unique within the domain. To get a list of all currently
--   registered workflow types, use the <tt>ListWorkflowTypes</tt> action.
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <a>/</a> (slash), '|' (vertical
--   bar), or any control characters (u0000-u001f | u007f - u009f). Also,
--   it must not contain the literal string quotarnquot.
rwtVersion :: Lens' RegisterWorkflowType Text
data RegisterWorkflowTypeResponse

-- | <a>RegisterWorkflowTypeResponse</a> constructor.
registerWorkflowTypeResponse :: RegisterWorkflowTypeResponse
instance Eq RegisterWorkflowType
instance Read RegisterWorkflowType
instance Show RegisterWorkflowType
instance Eq RegisterWorkflowTypeResponse
instance Ord RegisterWorkflowTypeResponse
instance Read RegisterWorkflowTypeResponse
instance Show RegisterWorkflowTypeResponse
instance Generic RegisterWorkflowTypeResponse
instance Datatype D1RegisterWorkflowTypeResponse
instance Constructor C1_0RegisterWorkflowTypeResponse
instance AWSRequest RegisterWorkflowType
instance ToJSON RegisterWorkflowType
instance ToHeaders RegisterWorkflowType
instance ToQuery RegisterWorkflowType
instance ToPath RegisterWorkflowType


-- | Registers a new domain.
--   
--   Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   You cannot use an IAM policy to control domain access for this action.
--   The name of the domain being registered is available as the resource
--   of this action. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to allow or deny
--   permission to call this action. You cannot use an IAM policy to
--   constrain this action's parameters. If the caller does not have
--   sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter values
--   fall outside the specified constraints, the action fails. The
--   associated event attribute's cause parameter will be set to
--   OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and example IAM policies, see
--   <a>Using IAMto Manage Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/apireference/API_RegisterDomain.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SWF.RegisterDomain
data RegisterDomain

-- | <a>RegisterDomain</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rdDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rdName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rdWorkflowExecutionRetentionPeriodInDays</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
registerDomain :: Text -> Text -> RegisterDomain

-- | A text description of the domain.
rdDescription :: Lens' RegisterDomain (Maybe Text)

-- | Name of the domain to register. The name must be unique in the region
--   that the domain is registered in.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <a>/</a> (slash), '|' (vertical
--   bar), or any control characters (u0000-u001f | u007f - u009f). Also,
--   it must not contain the literal string quotarnquot.
rdName :: Lens' RegisterDomain Text

-- | The duration (in days) that records and histories of workflow
--   executions on the domain should be kept by the service. After the
--   retention period, the workflow execution is not available in the
--   results of visibility calls.
--   
--   If you pass the value <tt>NONE</tt> or '0' (zero), then the workflow
--   execution history will not be retained. As soon as the workflow
--   execution completes, the execution record and its history are deleted.
--   
--   The maximum workflow execution retention period is 90 days. For more
--   information about Amazon SWF service limits, see: <a>Amazon SWF
--   Service Limits</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
rdWorkflowExecutionRetentionPeriodInDays :: Lens' RegisterDomain Text
data RegisterDomainResponse

-- | <a>RegisterDomainResponse</a> constructor.
registerDomainResponse :: RegisterDomainResponse

instance Ord RegisterDomain
instance Read RegisterDomain
instance Show RegisterDomain

instance Show RegisterDomainResponse
instance Generic RegisterDomainResponse

instance AWSRequest RegisterDomain
instance ToJSON RegisterDomain

instance ToQuery RegisterDomain

-- | Registers a new <i>activity type</i> along with its configuration
--   settings in the specified domain.
--   
--   A <tt>TypeAlreadyExists</tt> fault is returned if the type already
--   exists in the domain. You cannot change any configuration settings of
--   the type after its registration, and it must be registered as a new
--   version. Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to
--   allow or deny permission to call this action. Constrain the following
--   parameters by using a <tt>Condition</tt> element with the appropriate
--   keys. 'defaultTaskList.name': String constraint. The key is
--   'swf:defaultTaskList.name'. <tt>name</tt>: String constraint. The key
--   is 'swf:name'. <tt>version</tt>: String constraint. The key is
--   'swf:version'. If the caller does not have sufficient permissions to
--   invoke the action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified
--   constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's cause
--   parameter will be set to OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and
--   example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to AmazonSWF
--   Workflows</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/apireference/API_RegisterActivityType.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SWF.RegisterActivityType
data RegisterActivityType

-- | <a>RegisterActivityType</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ratDefaultTaskHeartbeatTimeout</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ratDefaultTaskList</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>TaskList</a></li>
--   <li><a>ratDefaultTaskPriority</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ratDefaultTaskScheduleToCloseTimeout</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ratDefaultTaskScheduleToStartTimeout</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ratDefaultTaskStartToCloseTimeout</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ratDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ratDomain</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ratName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ratVersion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
registerActivityType :: Text -> Text -> Text -> RegisterActivityType

-- | If set, specifies the default maximum time before which a worker
--   processing a task of this type must report progress by calling
--   <tt>RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat</tt>. If the timeout is exceeded, the
--   activity task is automatically timed out. This default can be
--   overridden when scheduling an activity task using the
--   <a>ScheduleActivityTask</a> <a>Decision</a>. If the activity worker
--   subsequently attempts to record a heartbeat or returns a result, the
--   activity worker receives an <tt>UnknownResource</tt> fault. In this
--   case, Amazon SWF no longer considers the activity task to be valid;
--   the activity worker should clean up the activity task.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds; an integer greater than or equal
--   to 0. The value <a>NONE</a> can be used to specify unlimited duration.
ratDefaultTaskHeartbeatTimeout :: Lens' RegisterActivityType (Maybe Text)

-- | If set, specifies the default task list to use for scheduling tasks of
--   this activity type. This default task list is used if a task list is
--   not provided when a task is scheduled through the
--   <a>ScheduleActivityTask</a> <a>Decision</a>.
ratDefaultTaskList :: Lens' RegisterActivityType (Maybe TaskList)

-- | The default task priority to assign to the activity type. If not
--   assigned, then "0" will be used. Valid values are integers that range
--   from Java's <a>MIN_VALUE</a> (-2147483648) to <a>MAX_VALUE</a>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon Simple Workflow Developer Guide</i>.
ratDefaultTaskPriority :: Lens' RegisterActivityType (Maybe Text)

-- | If set, specifies the default maximum duration for a task of this
--   activity type. This default can be overridden when scheduling an
--   activity task using the <a>ScheduleActivityTask</a> <a>Decision</a>.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds; an integer greater than or equal
--   to 0. The value <a>NONE</a> can be used to specify unlimited duration.
ratDefaultTaskScheduleToCloseTimeout :: Lens' RegisterActivityType (Maybe Text)

-- | If set, specifies the default maximum duration that a task of this
--   activity type can wait before being assigned to a worker. This default
--   can be overridden when scheduling an activity task using the
--   <a>ScheduleActivityTask</a> <a>Decision</a>.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds; an integer greater than or equal
--   to 0. The value <a>NONE</a> can be used to specify unlimited duration.
ratDefaultTaskScheduleToStartTimeout :: Lens' RegisterActivityType (Maybe Text)

-- | If set, specifies the default maximum duration that a worker can take
--   to process tasks of this activity type. This default can be overridden
--   when scheduling an activity task using the <a>ScheduleActivityTask</a>
--   <a>Decision</a>.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds; an integer greater than or equal
--   to 0. The value <a>NONE</a> can be used to specify unlimited duration.
ratDefaultTaskStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' RegisterActivityType (Maybe Text)

-- | A textual description of the activity type.
ratDescription :: Lens' RegisterActivityType (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the domain in which this activity is to be registered.
ratDomain :: Lens' RegisterActivityType Text

-- | The name of the activity type within the domain.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <a>/</a> (slash), '|' (vertical
--   bar), or any control characters (u0000-u001f | u007f - u009f). Also,
--   it must not contain the literal string quotarnquot.
ratName :: Lens' RegisterActivityType Text

-- | The version of the activity type.
--   
--   The activity type consists of the name and version, the combination of
--   which must be unique within the domain. The specified string must not
--   start or end with whitespace. It must not contain a <tt>:</tt>
--   (colon), <a>/</a> (slash), '|' (vertical bar), or any control
--   characters (u0000-u001f | u007f - u009f). Also, it must not contain
--   the literal string quotarnquot.
ratVersion :: Lens' RegisterActivityType Text

registerActivityTypeResponse :: RegisterActivityTypeResponse

instance ToPath RegisterActivityType


-- | Used by activity workers to report to the service that the
--   <tt>ActivityTask</tt> represented by the specified <tt>taskToken</tt>
--   is still making progress. The worker can also (optionally) specify
--   details of the progress, for example percent complete, using the
--   <tt>details</tt> parameter. This action can also be used by the worker
--   as a mechanism to check if cancellation is being requested for the
--   activity task. If a cancellation is being attempted for the specified
--   task, then the boolean <tt>cancelRequested</tt> flag returned by the
--   service is set to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   This action resets the <tt>taskHeartbeatTimeout</tt> clock. The
--   <tt>taskHeartbeatTimeout</tt> is specified in
--   <tt>RegisterActivityType</tt>.
--   
--   This action does not in itself create an event in the workflow
--   execution history. However, if the task times out, the workflow
--   execution history will contain a <a>ActivityTaskTimedOut</a> event
--   that contains the information from the last heartbeat generated by the
--   activity worker.
--   
--   The <tt>taskStartToCloseTimeout</tt> of an activity type is the
--   maximum duration of an activity task, regardless of the number of
--   <a>RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat</a> requests received. The
--   <tt>taskStartToCloseTimeout</tt> is also specified in
--   <tt>RegisterActivityType</tt>. This operation is only useful for
--   long-lived activities to report liveliness of the task and to
--   determine if a cancellation is being attempted. If the
--   <tt>cancelRequested</tt> flag returns <tt>true</tt>, a cancellation is
--   being attempted. If the worker can cancel the activity, it should
--   respond with <tt>RespondActivityTaskCanceled</tt>. Otherwise, it
--   should ignore the cancellation request. Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to
--   allow or deny permission to call this action. You cannot use an IAM
--   policy to constrain this action's parameters. If the caller does not
--   have sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter
--   values fall outside the specified constraints, the action fails. The
--   associated event attribute's cause parameter will be set to
--   OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and example IAM policies, see
--   <a>Using IAMto Manage Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/apireference/API_RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SWF.RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat
data RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat

-- | <a>RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rathDetails</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rathTaskToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
recordActivityTaskHeartbeat :: Text -> RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat

-- | If specified, contains details about the progress of the task.
rathDetails :: Lens' RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat (Maybe Text)

-- | The <tt>taskToken</tt> of the <tt>ActivityTask</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>taskToken</tt> is generated by the service and should be treated
--   as an opaque value. If the task is passed to another process, its
--   <tt>taskToken</tt> must also be passed. This enables it to provide its
--   progress and respond with results.
rathTaskToken :: Lens' RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat Text
data RecordActivityTaskHeartbeatResponse

-- | <a>RecordActivityTaskHeartbeatResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rathrCancelRequested</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   </ul>
recordActivityTaskHeartbeatResponse :: Bool -> RecordActivityTaskHeartbeatResponse

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> if cancellation of the task is requested.
rathrCancelRequested :: Lens' RecordActivityTaskHeartbeatResponse Bool
instance Eq RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat
instance Ord RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat
instance Read RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat
instance Show RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat
instance Eq RecordActivityTaskHeartbeatResponse
instance Ord RecordActivityTaskHeartbeatResponse
instance Read RecordActivityTaskHeartbeatResponse
instance Show RecordActivityTaskHeartbeatResponse
instance Enum RecordActivityTaskHeartbeatResponse
instance FromJSON RecordActivityTaskHeartbeatResponse
instance AWSRequest RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat
instance ToJSON RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat
instance ToHeaders RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat
instance ToQuery RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat
instance ToPath RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat


-- | Used by deciders to get a <tt>DecisionTask</tt> from the specified
--   decision <a>taskList</a>. A decision task may be returned for any open
--   workflow execution that is using the specified task list. The task
--   includes a paginated view of the history of the workflow execution.
--   The decider should use the workflow type and the history to determine
--   how to properly handle the task.
--   
--   This action initiates a long poll, where the service holds the HTTP
--   connection open and responds as soon a task becomes available. If no
--   decision task is available in the specified task list before the
--   timeout of 60 seconds expires, an empty result is returned. An empty
--   result, in this context, means that a DecisionTask is returned, but
--   that the value of taskToken is an empty string.
--   
--   Deciders should set their client side socket timeout to at least 70
--   seconds (10 seconds higher than the timeout). Because the number of
--   workflow history events for a single workflow execution might be very
--   large, the result returned might be split up across a number of pages.
--   To retrieve subsequent pages, make additional calls to
--   <a>PollForDecisionTask</a> using the <tt>nextPageToken</tt> returned
--   by the initial call. Note that you do not call
--   <tt>GetWorkflowExecutionHistory</tt> with this <tt>nextPageToken</tt>.
--   Instead, call <a>PollForDecisionTask</a> again. Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to
--   allow or deny permission to call this action. Constrain the
--   'taskList.name' parameter by using a Condition element with the
--   'swf:taskList.name' key to allow the action to access only certain
--   task lists. If the caller does not have sufficient permissions to
--   invoke the action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified
--   constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's cause
--   parameter will be set to OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and
--   example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to Amazon SWF
--   Workflows</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/apireference/API_PollForDecisionTask.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SWF.PollForDecisionTask
data PollForDecisionTask

-- | <a>PollForDecisionTask</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>pfdtDomain</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfdtIdentity</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfdtMaximumPageSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfdtNextPageToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfdtReverseOrder</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfdtTaskList</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>TaskList</a></li>
--   </ul>
pollForDecisionTask :: Text -> TaskList -> PollForDecisionTask

-- | The name of the domain containing the task lists to poll.
pfdtDomain :: Lens' PollForDecisionTask Text

-- | Identity of the decider making the request, which is recorded in the
--   DecisionTaskStarted event in the workflow history. This enables
--   diagnostic tracing when problems arise. The form of this identity is
--   user defined.
pfdtIdentity :: Lens' PollForDecisionTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results that will be returned per call.
--   <tt>nextPageToken</tt> can be used to obtain futher pages of results.
--   The default is 100, which is the maximum allowed page size. You can,
--   however, specify a page size <i>smaller</i> than 100.
--   
--   This is an upper limit only; the actual number of results returned per
--   call may be fewer than the specified maximum.
pfdtMaximumPageSize :: Lens' PollForDecisionTask (Maybe Natural)

-- | If a <tt>NextPageToken</tt> was returned by a previous call, there are
--   more results available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the
--   call again using the returned token in <tt>nextPageToken</tt>. Keep
--   all other arguments unchanged.
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
--   
--   The <tt>nextPageToken</tt> returned by this action cannot be used with
--   <tt>GetWorkflowExecutionHistory</tt> to get the next page. You must
--   call <a>PollForDecisionTask</a> again (with the
--   <tt>nextPageToken</tt>) to retrieve the next page of history records.
--   Calling <a>PollForDecisionTask</a> with a <tt>nextPageToken</tt> will
--   not return a new decision task..
pfdtNextPageToken :: Lens' PollForDecisionTask (Maybe Text)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, returns the events in reverse order. By
--   default the results are returned in ascending order of the
--   <tt>eventTimestamp</tt> of the events.
pfdtReverseOrder :: Lens' PollForDecisionTask (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the task list to poll for decision tasks.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <a>/</a> (slash), '|' (vertical
--   bar), or any control characters (u0000-u001f | u007f - u009f). Also,
--   it must not contain the literal string quotarnquot.
pfdtTaskList :: Lens' PollForDecisionTask TaskList
data PollForDecisionTaskResponse

-- | <a>PollForDecisionTaskResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>pfdtrEvents</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>HistoryEvent</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>pfdtrNextPageToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfdtrPreviousStartedEventId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Integer</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfdtrStartedEventId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Integer</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfdtrTaskToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfdtrWorkflowExecution</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>WorkflowExecution</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfdtrWorkflowType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>WorkflowType</a></li>
--   </ul>
pollForDecisionTaskResponse :: Text -> Integer -> WorkflowExecution -> WorkflowType -> PollForDecisionTaskResponse

-- | A paginated list of history events of the workflow execution. The
--   decider uses this during the processing of the decision task.
pfdtrEvents :: Lens' PollForDecisionTaskResponse [HistoryEvent]

-- | If a <tt>NextPageToken</tt> was returned by a previous call, there are
--   more results available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the
--   call again using the returned token in <tt>nextPageToken</tt>. Keep
--   all other arguments unchanged.
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
pfdtrNextPageToken :: Lens' PollForDecisionTaskResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The id of the DecisionTaskStarted event of the previous decision task
--   of this workflow execution that was processed by the decider. This can
--   be used to determine the events in the history new since the last
--   decision task received by the decider.
pfdtrPreviousStartedEventId :: Lens' PollForDecisionTaskResponse (Maybe Integer)

-- | The id of the <a>DecisionTaskStarted</a> event recorded in the
--   history.
pfdtrStartedEventId :: Lens' PollForDecisionTaskResponse Integer

-- | The opaque string used as a handle on the task. This token is used by
--   workers to communicate progress and response information back to the
--   system about the task.
pfdtrTaskToken :: Lens' PollForDecisionTaskResponse Text

-- | The workflow execution for which this decision task was created.
pfdtrWorkflowExecution :: Lens' PollForDecisionTaskResponse WorkflowExecution

-- | The type of the workflow execution for which this decision task was
--   created.
pfdtrWorkflowType :: Lens' PollForDecisionTaskResponse WorkflowType
instance Eq PollForDecisionTask
instance Read PollForDecisionTask
instance Show PollForDecisionTask
instance Eq PollForDecisionTaskResponse
instance Read PollForDecisionTaskResponse
instance Show PollForDecisionTaskResponse
instance AWSPager PollForDecisionTask
instance FromJSON PollForDecisionTaskResponse
instance AWSRequest PollForDecisionTask
instance ToJSON PollForDecisionTask
instance ToHeaders PollForDecisionTask
instance ToQuery PollForDecisionTask
instance ToPath PollForDecisionTask


-- | Used by workers to get an <tt>ActivityTask</tt> from the specified
--   activity <a>taskList</a>. This initiates a long poll, where the
--   service holds the HTTP connection open and responds as soon as a task
--   becomes available. The maximum time the service holds on to the
--   request before responding is 60 seconds. If no task is available
--   within 60 seconds, the poll will return an empty result. An empty
--   result, in this context, means that an ActivityTask is returned, but
--   that the value of taskToken is an empty string. If a task is returned,
--   the worker should use its type to identify and process it correctly.
--   
--   Workers should set their client side socket timeout to at least 70
--   seconds (10 seconds higher than the maximum time service may hold the
--   poll request). Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to
--   allow or deny permission to call this action. Constrain the
--   'taskList.name' parameter by using a Condition element with the
--   'swf:taskList.name' key to allow the action to access only certain
--   task lists. If the caller does not have sufficient permissions to
--   invoke the action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified
--   constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's cause
--   parameter will be set to OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and
--   example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to Amazon SWF
--   Workflows</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/apireference/API_PollForActivityTask.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SWF.PollForActivityTask
data PollForActivityTask

-- | <a>PollForActivityTask</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>pfatDomain</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfatIdentity</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfatTaskList</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>TaskList</a></li>
--   </ul>
pollForActivityTask :: Text -> TaskList -> PollForActivityTask

-- | The name of the domain that contains the task lists being polled.
pfatDomain :: Lens' PollForActivityTask Text

-- | Identity of the worker making the request, recorded in the
--   <a>ActivityTaskStarted</a> event in the workflow history. This enables
--   diagnostic tracing when problems arise. The form of this identity is
--   user defined.
pfatIdentity :: Lens' PollForActivityTask (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the task list to poll for activity tasks.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <a>/</a> (slash), '|' (vertical
--   bar), or any control characters (u0000-u001f | u007f - u009f). Also,
--   it must not contain the literal string quotarnquot.
pfatTaskList :: Lens' PollForActivityTask TaskList
data PollForActivityTaskResponse

-- | <a>PollForActivityTaskResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>pfatrActivityId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfatrActivityType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>ActivityType</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfatrInput</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfatrStartedEventId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Integer</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfatrTaskToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pfatrWorkflowExecution</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>WorkflowExecution</a></li>
--   </ul>
pollForActivityTaskResponse :: Text -> Text -> Integer -> WorkflowExecution -> ActivityType -> PollForActivityTaskResponse

-- | The unique ID of the task.
pfatrActivityId :: Lens' PollForActivityTaskResponse Text

-- | The type of this activity task.
pfatrActivityType :: Lens' PollForActivityTaskResponse ActivityType

-- | The inputs provided when the activity task was scheduled. The form of
--   the input is user defined and should be meaningful to the activity
--   implementation.
pfatrInput :: Lens' PollForActivityTaskResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The id of the <a>ActivityTaskStarted</a> event recorded in the
--   history.
pfatrStartedEventId :: Lens' PollForActivityTaskResponse Integer

-- | The opaque string used as a handle on the task. This token is used by
--   workers to communicate progress and response information back to the
--   system about the task.
pfatrTaskToken :: Lens' PollForActivityTaskResponse Text

-- | The workflow execution that started this activity task.
pfatrWorkflowExecution :: Lens' PollForActivityTaskResponse WorkflowExecution
instance Eq PollForActivityTask
instance Read PollForActivityTask
instance Show PollForActivityTask
instance Eq PollForActivityTaskResponse
instance Read PollForActivityTaskResponse
instance Show PollForActivityTaskResponse
instance FromJSON PollForActivityTaskResponse
instance AWSRequest PollForActivityTask
instance ToJSON PollForActivityTask
instance ToHeaders PollForActivityTask
instance ToQuery PollForActivityTask
instance ToPath PollForActivityTask


-- | Returns information about workflow types in the specified domain. The
--   results may be split into multiple pages that can be retrieved by
--   making the call repeatedly.
--   
--   Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to
--   allow or deny permission to call this action. You cannot use an IAM
--   policy to constrain this action's parameters. If the caller does not
--   have sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter
--   values fall outside the specified constraints, the action fails. The
--   associated event attribute's cause parameter will be set to
--   OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and example IAM policies, see
--   <a>Using IAMto Manage Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/apireference/API_ListWorkflowTypes.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SWF.ListWorkflowTypes
data ListWorkflowTypes

-- | <a>ListWorkflowTypes</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>lwtDomain</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lwtMaximumPageSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>lwtName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lwtNextPageToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lwtRegistrationStatus</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>RegistrationStatus</a></li>
--   <li><a>lwtReverseOrder</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   </ul>
listWorkflowTypes :: Text -> RegistrationStatus -> ListWorkflowTypes

-- | The name of the domain in which the workflow types have been
--   registered.
lwtDomain :: Lens' ListWorkflowTypes Text

-- | The maximum number of results that will be returned per call.
--   <tt>nextPageToken</tt> can be used to obtain futher pages of results.
--   The default is 100, which is the maximum allowed page size. You can,
--   however, specify a page size <i>smaller</i> than 100.
--   
--   This is an upper limit only; the actual number of results returned per
--   call may be fewer than the specified maximum.
lwtMaximumPageSize :: Lens' ListWorkflowTypes (Maybe Natural)

-- | If specified, lists the workflow type with this name.
lwtName :: Lens' ListWorkflowTypes (Maybe Text)

-- | If a <tt>NextPageToken</tt> was returned by a previous call, there are
--   more results available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the
--   call again using the returned token in <tt>nextPageToken</tt>. Keep
--   all other arguments unchanged.
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
lwtNextPageToken :: Lens' ListWorkflowTypes (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the registration status of the workflow types to list.
lwtRegistrationStatus :: Lens' ListWorkflowTypes RegistrationStatus

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, returns the results in reverse order. By
--   default the results are returned in ascending alphabetical order of
--   the <tt>name</tt> of the workflow types.
lwtReverseOrder :: Lens' ListWorkflowTypes (Maybe Bool)
data ListWorkflowTypesResponse

-- | <a>ListWorkflowTypesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--

--   </ul>
listWorkflowTypesResponse :: ListWorkflowTypesResponse

-- | Returns a list of open workflow executions in the specified domain
--   that meet the filtering criteria. The results may be split into
--   multiple pages. To retrieve subsequent pages, make the call again
--   using the nextPageToken returned by the initial call.
--   
--   This operation is eventually consistent. The results are best effort
--   and may not exactly reflect recent updates and changes. Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to
--   allow or deny permission to call this action. Constrain the following
--   parameters by using a <tt>Condition</tt> element with the appropriate
--   keys. 'tagFilter.tag': String constraint. The key is
--   'swf:tagFilter.tag'. 'typeFilter.name': String constraint. The key is
--   'swf:typeFilter.name'. 'typeFilter.version': String constraint. The
--   key is 'swf:typeFilter.version'. If the caller does not have
--   sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter values
--   fall outside the specified constraints, the action fails. The
--   associated event attribute's cause parameter will be set to
--   OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and example IAM policies, see
--   <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to AmazonSWF Workflows</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/apireference/API_ListOpenWorkflowExecutions.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SWF.ListOpenWorkflowExecutions
data ListOpenWorkflowExecutions

-- | <a>ListOpenWorkflowExecutions</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>loweDomain</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>loweExecutionFilter</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>WorkflowExecutionFilter</a></li>
--   <li><a>loweMaximumPageSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>loweNextPageToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>loweReverseOrder</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>loweStartTimeFilter</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>ExecutionTimeFilter</a></li>
--   <li><a>loweTagFilter</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>TagFilter</a></li>
--   <li><a>loweTypeFilter</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>WorkflowTypeFilter</a></li>
--   </ul>
listOpenWorkflowExecutions :: Text -> ExecutionTimeFilter -> ListOpenWorkflowExecutions

-- | The name of the domain that contains the workflow executions to list.
loweDomain :: Lens' ListOpenWorkflowExecutions Text

-- | If specified, only workflow executions matching the workflow id
--   specified in the filter are returned.
--   
--   <tt>executionFilter</tt>, <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <a>tagFilter</a> are
--   mutually exclusive. You can specify at most one of these in a request.
loweExecutionFilter :: Lens' ListOpenWorkflowExecutions (Maybe WorkflowExecutionFilter)

-- | The maximum number of results that will be returned per call.
--   <tt>nextPageToken</tt> can be used to obtain futher pages of results.
--   The default is 100, which is the maximum allowed page size. You can,
--   however, specify a page size <i>smaller</i> than 100.
--   
--   This is an upper limit only; the actual number of results returned per
--   call may be fewer than the specified maximum.
loweMaximumPageSize :: Lens' ListOpenWorkflowExecutions (Maybe Natural)

-- | If a <tt>NextPageToken</tt> was returned by a previous call, there are
--   more results available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the
--   call again using the returned token in <tt>nextPageToken</tt>. Keep
--   all other arguments unchanged.
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
loweNextPageToken :: Lens' ListOpenWorkflowExecutions (Maybe Text)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, returns the results in reverse order. By
--   default the results are returned in descending order of the start time
--   of the executions.
loweReverseOrder :: Lens' ListOpenWorkflowExecutions (Maybe Bool)

-- | Workflow executions are included in the returned results based on
--   whether their start times are within the range specified by this
--   filter.
loweStartTimeFilter :: Lens' ListOpenWorkflowExecutions ExecutionTimeFilter

-- | If specified, only executions that have the matching tag are listed.
--   
--   <tt>executionFilter</tt>, <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <a>tagFilter</a> are
--   mutually exclusive. You can specify at most one of these in a request.
loweTagFilter :: Lens' ListOpenWorkflowExecutions (Maybe TagFilter)

-- | If specified, only executions of the type specified in the filter are
--   returned.
--   
--   <tt>executionFilter</tt>, <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <a>tagFilter</a> are
--   mutually exclusive. You can specify at most one of these in a request.
loweTypeFilter :: Lens' ListOpenWorkflowExecutions (Maybe WorkflowTypeFilter)

-- | Returns the list of domains registered in the account. The results may
--   be split into multiple pages. To retrieve subsequent pages, make the
--   call again using the nextPageToken returned by the initial call.
--   
--   This operation is eventually consistent. The results are best effort
--   and may not exactly reflect recent updates and changes. Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains. The element must be set to
--   'arn:aws:swf::AccountID:domain/*', where <i>AccountID</i> is the
--   account ID, with no dashes. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to allow or
--   deny permission to call this action. You cannot use an IAM policy to
--   constrain this action's parameters. If the caller does not have
--   sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter values
--   fall outside the specified constraints, the action fails. The
--   associated event attribute's cause parameter will be set to
--   OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and example IAM policies, see
--   <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/apireference/API_ListDomains.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SWF.ListDomains
data ListDomains

-- | <a>ListDomains</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ldMaximumPageSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>ldNextPageToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ldRegistrationStatus</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>RegistrationStatus</a></li>
--   <li><a>ldReverseOrder</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   </ul>
listDomains :: RegistrationStatus -> ListDomains

-- | The maximum number of results that will be returned per call.
--   <tt>nextPageToken</tt> can be used to obtain futher pages of results.
--   The default is 100, which is the maximum allowed page size. You can,
--   however, specify a page size <i>smaller</i> than 100.
--   
--   This is an upper limit only; the actual number of results returned per
--   call may be fewer than the specified maximum.
ldMaximumPageSize :: Lens' ListDomains (Maybe Natural)

-- | If a <tt>NextPageToken</tt> was returned by a previous call, there are
--   more results available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the
--   call again using the returned token in <tt>nextPageToken</tt>. Keep
--   all other arguments unchanged.
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
ldNextPageToken :: Lens' ListDomains (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the registration status of the domains to list.
ldRegistrationStatus :: Lens' ListDomains RegistrationStatus

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, returns the results in reverse order. By
--   default, the results are returned in ascending alphabetical order by
--   <tt>name</tt> of the domains.
ldReverseOrder :: Lens' ListDomains (Maybe Bool)
data ListDomainsResponse

-- | <a>ListDomainsResponse</a> constructor.

--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--

--   <li><a>ldrNextPageToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
listDomainsResponse :: ListDomainsResponse

ldrDomainInfos :: Lens' ListDomainsResponse [DomainInfo]

--   more results available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the
--   call again using the returned token in <tt>nextPageToken</tt>. Keep
--   all other arguments unchanged.
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
ldrNextPageToken :: Lens' ListDomainsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Returns a list of closed workflow executions in the specified domain
--   that meet the filtering criteria. The results may be split into
--   multiple pages. To retrieve subsequent pages, make the call again
--   using the nextPageToken returned by the initial call.
--   
--   This operation is eventually consistent. The results are best effort
--   and may not exactly reflect recent updates and changes. Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to
--   allow or deny permission to call this action. Constrain the following
--   parameters by using a <tt>Condition</tt> element with the appropriate
--   keys. 'tagFilter.tag': String constraint. The key is
--   'swf:tagFilter.tag'. 'typeFilter.name': String constraint. The key is
--   'swf:typeFilter.name'. 'typeFilter.version': String constraint. The
--   key is 'swf:typeFilter.version'. If the caller does not have
--   sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter values
--   fall outside the specified constraints, the action fails. The
--   associated event attribute's cause parameter will be set to
--   OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and example IAM policies, see
--   <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to AmazonSWF Workflows</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/apireference/API_ListClosedWorkflowExecutions.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SWF.ListClosedWorkflowExecutions
data ListClosedWorkflowExecutions

-- | <a>ListClosedWorkflowExecutions</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>lcweCloseStatusFilter</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>CloseStatusFilter</a></li>
--   <li><a>lcweCloseTimeFilter</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>ExecutionTimeFilter</a></li>
--   <li><a>lcweDomain</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lcweExecutionFilter</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>WorkflowExecutionFilter</a></li>
--   <li><a>lcweMaximumPageSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>lcweNextPageToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lcweReverseOrder</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>lcweStartTimeFilter</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>ExecutionTimeFilter</a></li>
--   <li><a>lcweTagFilter</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>TagFilter</a></li>
--   <li><a>lcweTypeFilter</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>WorkflowTypeFilter</a></li>
--   </ul>
listClosedWorkflowExecutions :: Text -> ListClosedWorkflowExecutions

-- | If specified, only workflow executions that match this <i>close
--   status</i> are listed. For example, if TERMINATED is specified, then
--   only TERMINATED workflow executions are listed.
--   
--   <a>closeStatusFilter</a>, <tt>executionFilter</tt>,
--   <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <a>tagFilter</a> are mutually exclusive. You
--   can specify at most one of these in a request.
lcweCloseStatusFilter :: Lens' ListClosedWorkflowExecutions (Maybe CloseStatusFilter)

-- | If specified, the workflow executions are included in the returned
--   results based on whether their close times are within the range
--   specified by this filter. Also, if this parameter is specified, the
--   returned results are ordered by their close times.
--   
--   <tt>startTimeFilter</tt> and <tt>closeTimeFilter</tt> are mutually
--   exclusive. You must specify one of these in a request but not both.
lcweCloseTimeFilter :: Lens' ListClosedWorkflowExecutions (Maybe ExecutionTimeFilter)

-- | The name of the domain that contains the workflow executions to list.
lcweDomain :: Lens' ListClosedWorkflowExecutions Text

-- | If specified, only workflow executions matching the workflow id
--   specified in the filter are returned.
--   
--   <a>closeStatusFilter</a>, <tt>executionFilter</tt>,
--   <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <a>tagFilter</a> are mutually exclusive. You
--   can specify at most one of these in a request.
lcweExecutionFilter :: Lens' ListClosedWorkflowExecutions (Maybe WorkflowExecutionFilter)

-- | The maximum number of results that will be returned per call.
--   <tt>nextPageToken</tt> can be used to obtain futher pages of results.
--   The default is 100, which is the maximum allowed page size. You can,
--   however, specify a page size <i>smaller</i> than 100.
--   
--   This is an upper limit only; the actual number of results returned per
--   call may be fewer than the specified maximum.
lcweMaximumPageSize :: Lens' ListClosedWorkflowExecutions (Maybe Natural)

-- | If a <tt>NextPageToken</tt> was returned by a previous call, there are
--   more results available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the
--   call again using the returned token in <tt>nextPageToken</tt>. Keep
--   all other arguments unchanged.
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
lcweNextPageToken :: Lens' ListClosedWorkflowExecutions (Maybe Text)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, returns the results in reverse order. By
--   default the results are returned in descending order of the start or
--   the close time of the executions.
lcweReverseOrder :: Lens' ListClosedWorkflowExecutions (Maybe Bool)

-- | If specified, the workflow executions are included in the returned
--   results based on whether their start times are within the range
--   specified by this filter. Also, if this parameter is specified, the
--   returned results are ordered by their start times.
--   
--   <tt>startTimeFilter</tt> and <tt>closeTimeFilter</tt> are mutually
--   exclusive. You must specify one of these in a request but not both.
lcweStartTimeFilter :: Lens' ListClosedWorkflowExecutions (Maybe ExecutionTimeFilter)

-- | If specified, only executions that have the matching tag are listed.
--   
--   <a>closeStatusFilter</a>, <tt>executionFilter</tt>,
--   <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <a>tagFilter</a> are mutually exclusive. You
--   can specify at most one of these in a request.
lcweTagFilter :: Lens' ListClosedWorkflowExecutions (Maybe TagFilter)

-- | If specified, only executions of the type specified in the filter are
--   returned.
--   
--   <a>closeStatusFilter</a>, <tt>executionFilter</tt>,
--   <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <a>tagFilter</a> are mutually exclusive. You
--   can specify at most one of these in a request.
lcweTypeFilter :: Lens' ListClosedWorkflowExecutions (Maybe WorkflowTypeFilter)

--   domain that match the specified name and registration status. The
--   result includes information like creation date, current status of the
--   activity, etc. The results may be split into multiple pages. To
--   retrieve subsequent pages, make the call again using the
--   <tt>nextPageToken</tt> returned by the initial call.
--   
--   Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF

--   </ul>

--   registered.

latRegistrationStatus :: Lens' ListActivityTypes RegistrationStatus

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, returns the results in reverse order. By
--   default, the results are returned in ascending alphabetical order by
--   <tt>name</tt> of the activity types.
latReverseOrder :: Lens' ListActivityTypes (Maybe Bool)

--   may be split into multiple pages. To retrieve subsequent pages, make

--   initial call.

--   This operation is eventually consistent. The results are best effort

--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--

--   have sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter

module Network.AWS.SWF.GetWorkflowExecutionHistory

-- | <a>GetWorkflowExecutionHistory</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>gwehDomain</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>

--   <li><a>gwehMaximumPageSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>gwehNextPageToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>gwehReverseOrder</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   </ul>
getWorkflowExecutionHistory :: Text -> WorkflowExecution -> GetWorkflowExecutionHistory

-- | The name of the domain containing the workflow execution.
gwehDomain :: Lens' GetWorkflowExecutionHistory Text

-- | Specifies the workflow execution for which to return the history.
gwehExecution :: Lens' GetWorkflowExecutionHistory WorkflowExecution

--   <tt>nextPageToken</tt> can be used to obtain futher pages of results.

gwehNextPageToken :: Lens' GetWorkflowExecutionHistory (Maybe Text)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, returns the events in reverse order. By
--   default the results are returned in ascending order of the
--   <tt>eventTimeStamp</tt> of the events.
gwehReverseOrder :: Lens' GetWorkflowExecutionHistory (Maybe Bool)

--   parameters by using a <tt>Condition</tt> element with the appropriate
--   keys. 'workflowType.name': String constraint. The key is
--   'swf:workflowType.name'. 'workflowType.version': String constraint.
--   The key is 'swf:workflowType.version' . If the caller does not have
--   sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter values
--   fall outside the specified constraints, the action fails. The
--   associated event attribute's cause parameter will be set to
--   OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and example IAM policies, see

--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dwtDomain</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dwtWorkflowType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>WorkflowType</a></li>
--   </ul>

--   </ul>

--   <tt>RegisterWorkflowType</tt>
dwtrConfiguration :: Lens' DescribeWorkflowTypeResponse WorkflowTypeConfiguration

-- | General information about the workflow type.
--   
--   The status of the workflow type (returned in the WorkflowTypeInfo
--   structure) can be one of the following.
--   
--   REGISTERED: The type is registered and available. Workers supporting
--   this type should be running. DEPRECATED: The type was deprecated using
--   <tt>DeprecateWorkflowType</tt>, but is still in use. You should keep
--   workers supporting this type running. You cannot create new workflow
--   executions of this type.
dwtrTypeInfo :: Lens' DescribeWorkflowTypeResponse WorkflowTypeInfo

module Network.AWS.SWF.DescribeWorkflowExecution
data DescribeWorkflowExecution

-- | <a>DescribeWorkflowExecution</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dweDomain</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>

-- | <a>DescribeWorkflowExecutionResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dwerExecutionConfiguration</a> <tt>::</tt>

--   <a>WorkflowExecutionInfo</a></li>

--   <a>UTCTime</a></li>
--   <li><a>dwerLatestExecutionContext</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dwerOpenCounts</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeWorkflowExecutionResponse :: WorkflowExecutionInfo -> WorkflowExecutionConfiguration -> WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts -> DescribeWorkflowExecutionResponse

-- | The configuration settings for this workflow execution including
--   timeout values, tasklist etc.
dwerExecutionConfiguration :: Lens' DescribeWorkflowExecutionResponse WorkflowExecutionConfiguration

-- | Information about the workflow execution.
dwerExecutionInfo :: Lens' DescribeWorkflowExecutionResponse WorkflowExecutionInfo

-- | The time when the last activity task was scheduled for this workflow
--   execution. You can use this information to determine if the workflow
--   has not made progress for an unusually long period of time and might
--   require a corrective action.
dwerLatestActivityTaskTimestamp :: Lens' DescribeWorkflowExecutionResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The latest executionContext provided by the decider for this workflow
--   execution. A decider can provide an executionContext (a free-form
--   string) when closing a decision task using
--   <tt>RespondDecisionTaskCompleted</tt>.
dwerLatestExecutionContext :: Lens' DescribeWorkflowExecutionResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of tasks for this workflow execution. This includes open
--   and closed tasks of all types.
dwerOpenCounts :: Lens' DescribeWorkflowExecutionResponse WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts

--   <li><a>ddrConfiguration</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>DomainConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>ddrDomainInfo</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>DomainInfo</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeDomainResponse :: DomainInfo -> DomainConfiguration -> DescribeDomainResponse
ddrConfiguration :: Lens' DescribeDomainResponse DomainConfiguration
ddrDomainInfo :: Lens' DescribeDomainResponse DomainInfo
instance Eq DescribeDomain
instance Ord DescribeDomain
instance Read DescribeDomain
instance Show DescribeDomain
instance Monoid DescribeDomain
instance IsString DescribeDomain
instance Eq DescribeDomainResponse
instance Read DescribeDomainResponse
instance Show DescribeDomainResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeDomainResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeDomain
instance ToJSON DescribeDomain
instance ToHeaders DescribeDomain
instance ToQuery DescribeDomain
instance ToPath DescribeDomain


-- | Returns information about the specified activity type. This includes
--   configuration settings provided when the type was registered and other
--   general information about the type.
--   
--   Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to
--   allow or deny permission to call this action. Constrain the following
--   parameters by using a <tt>Condition</tt> element with the appropriate
--   keys. 'activityType.name': String constraint. The key is
--   'swf:activityType.name'. 'activityType.version': String constraint.
--   The key is 'swf:activityType.version' . If the caller does not have
--   sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter values
--   fall outside the specified constraints, the action fails. The
--   associated event attribute's cause parameter will be set to
--   OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and example IAM policies, see
--   <a>Using IAMto Manage Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/apireference/API_DescribeActivityType.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SWF.DescribeActivityType
data DescribeActivityType

-- | <a>DescribeActivityType</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>datActivityType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>ActivityType</a></li>
--   <li><a>datDomain</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeActivityType :: Text -> ActivityType -> DescribeActivityType

-- | The activity type to get information about. Activity types are
--   identified by the <tt>name</tt> and <tt>version</tt> that were
--   supplied when the activity was registered.
datActivityType :: Lens' DescribeActivityType ActivityType

-- | The name of the domain in which the activity type is registered.
datDomain :: Lens' DescribeActivityType Text
data DescribeActivityTypeResponse

-- | <a>DescribeActivityTypeResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>datrConfiguration</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>ActivityTypeConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>datrTypeInfo</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>ActivityTypeInfo</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeActivityTypeResponse :: ActivityTypeInfo -> ActivityTypeConfiguration -> DescribeActivityTypeResponse

-- | The configuration settings registered with the activity type.
datrConfiguration :: Lens' DescribeActivityTypeResponse ActivityTypeConfiguration

-- | General information about the activity type.
--   
--   The status of activity type (returned in the ActivityTypeInfo
--   structure) can be one of the following.
--   
--   REGISTERED: The type is registered and available. Workers supporting
--   this type should be running. DEPRECATED: The type was deprecated using
--   <tt>DeprecateActivityType</tt>, but is still in use. You should keep
--   workers supporting this type running. You cannot create new tasks of
--   this type.
datrTypeInfo :: Lens' DescribeActivityTypeResponse ActivityTypeInfo
instance Eq DescribeActivityType
instance Read DescribeActivityType
instance Show DescribeActivityType

instance Show DescribeActivityTypeResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeActivityTypeResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeActivityType
instance ToJSON DescribeActivityType
instance ToHeaders DescribeActivityType
instance ToQuery DescribeActivityType
instance ToPath DescribeActivityType


-- | Deprecates the specified <i>workflow type</i>. After a workflow type
--   has been deprecated, you cannot create new executions of that type.
--   Executions that were started before the type was deprecated will
--   continue to run. A deprecated workflow type may still be used when
--   calling visibility actions.
--   
--   This operation is eventually consistent. The results are best effort
--   and may not exactly reflect recent updates and changes. Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to
--   allow or deny permission to call this action. Constrain the following
--   parameters by using a <tt>Condition</tt> element with the appropriate
--   keys. 'workflowType.name': String constraint. The key is
--   'swf:workflowType.name'. 'workflowType.version': String constraint.
--   The key is 'swf:workflowType.version' . If the caller does not have
--   sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter values
--   fall outside the specified constraints, the action fails. The
--   associated event attribute's cause parameter will be set to
--   OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and example IAM policies, see
--   <a>Using IAMto Manage Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a>.

-- | Deprecates the specified domain. After a domain has been deprecated it
--   cannot be used to create new workflow executions or register new
--   types. However, you can still use visibility actions on this domain.
--   Deprecating a domain also deprecates all activity and workflow types
--   registered in the domain. Executions that were started before the
--   domain was deprecated will continue to run.
--   
--   This operation is eventually consistent. The results are best effort
--   and may not exactly reflect recent updates and changes. Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to
--   allow or deny permission to call this action. You cannot use an IAM
--   policy to constrain this action's parameters. If the caller does not
--   have sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter
--   values fall outside the specified constraints, the action fails. The
--   associated event attribute's cause parameter will be set to
--   OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and example IAM policies, see
--   <a>Using IAMto Manage Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/apireference/API_DeprecateDomain.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SWF.DeprecateDomain

--   </ul>

-- | Returns the estimated number of decision tasks in the specified task
--   list. The count returned is an approximation and is not guaranteed to
--   be exact. If you specify a task list that no decision task was ever
--   scheduled in then 0 will be returned.
--   
--   Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to

--   'taskList.name' parameter by using a Condition element with the
--   'swf:taskList.name' key to allow the action to access only certain
--   task lists. If the caller does not have sufficient permissions to
--   invoke the action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified
--   constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's cause
--   parameter will be set to OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and

--   Workflows</a>.

-- | Returns the number of open workflow executions within the given domain
--   that meet the specified filtering criteria.
--   
--   This operation is eventually consistent. The results are best effort
--   and may not exactly reflect recent updates and changes. Access Control
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains. Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to
--   allow or deny permission to call this action. Constrain the following
--   parameters by using a <tt>Condition</tt> element with the appropriate
--   keys. 'tagFilter.tag': String constraint. The key is
--   'swf:tagFilter.tag'. 'typeFilter.name': String constraint. The key is
--   'swf:typeFilter.name'. 'typeFilter.version': String constraint. The
--   key is 'swf:typeFilter.version'. If the caller does not have
--   sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter values
--   fall outside the specified constraints, the action fails. The
--   associated event attribute's cause parameter will be set to
--   OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and example IAM policies, see
--   <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to AmazonSWF Workflows</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/apireference/API_CountOpenWorkflowExecutions.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SWF.CountOpenWorkflowExecutions
data CountOpenWorkflowExecutions

-- | <a>CountOpenWorkflowExecutions</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>coweDomain</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>coweExecutionFilter</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>WorkflowExecutionFilter</a></li>
--   <li><a>coweStartTimeFilter</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>ExecutionTimeFilter</a></li>
--   <li><a>coweTagFilter</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>TagFilter</a></li>
--   <li><a>coweTypeFilter</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>WorkflowTypeFilter</a></li>
--   </ul>
countOpenWorkflowExecutions :: Text -> ExecutionTimeFilter -> CountOpenWorkflowExecutions

-- | The name of the domain containing the workflow executions to count.
coweDomain :: Lens' CountOpenWorkflowExecutions Text

-- | If specified, only workflow executions matching the
--   <tt>WorkflowId</tt> in the filter are counted.
--   
--   <tt>executionFilter</tt>, <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <a>tagFilter</a> are
--   mutually exclusive. You can specify at most one of these in a request.
coweExecutionFilter :: Lens' CountOpenWorkflowExecutions (Maybe WorkflowExecutionFilter)

-- | Specifies the start time criteria that workflow executions must meet
--   in order to be counted.
coweStartTimeFilter :: Lens' CountOpenWorkflowExecutions ExecutionTimeFilter

-- | If specified, only executions that have a tag that matches the filter
--   are counted.
--   
--   <tt>executionFilter</tt>, <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <a>tagFilter</a> are
--   mutually exclusive. You can specify at most one of these in a request.
coweTagFilter :: Lens' CountOpenWorkflowExecutions (Maybe TagFilter)

-- | Specifies the type of the workflow executions to be counted.
--   
--   <tt>executionFilter</tt>, <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <a>tagFilter</a> are
--   mutually exclusive. You can specify at most one of these in a request.
coweTypeFilter :: Lens' CountOpenWorkflowExecutions (Maybe WorkflowTypeFilter)
data CountOpenWorkflowExecutionsResponse

-- | <a>CountOpenWorkflowExecutionsResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--

--   <li><a>cowerTruncated</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   </ul>

cowerCount :: Lens' CountOpenWorkflowExecutionsResponse Natural

--   maximum supported by this API and the count returned is the truncated
--   value.
cowerTruncated :: Lens' CountOpenWorkflowExecutionsResponse (Maybe Bool)
